{"body":"<p>I am developing a multi-platform app using NativeScript and Angular and have to download a large amount of data from the server in the background. Right now I am using an Angular service for downloading, but when the user closes my app and opens it again a new copy of the service is started while the old one continues the loading, so the app has two services each of which loads data. How can I solve this problem? Or if I should run a background task for it, how can I do this and can I use my service in this task?</p>\n<p>My DataService, used to load data from server:</p>\n<pre><code>@Injectable({\n    providedIn: &quot;root&quot;\n})\nexport class DataService implements OnDestroy {\n    private helper: Helper;\n\n    constructor(private http: HttpClient, translate: TranslateService) {\n        this.helper = new Helper(translate);\n    }\n\n    downloadData(regionId, languageId: number = 2) {\n        return fetch(this.BASE_DOMAIN + &quot;/data/&quot; + regionId + &quot;_&quot; + languageId + &quot;.json&quot;)\n            .then((response) =&gt; response.json())\n            .then((responseJson) =&gt; {\n                this.helper.setOfflineStatus(false);\n                if (responseJson.length === undefined\n                    || responseJson.length === null\n                    || responseJson.length === 0) {\n                    responseJson = [];\n                }\n\n                return responseJson;\n            })\n            .catch((error) =&gt; {\n                console.error(error);\n                this.setOffline();\n            });\n    }\n\n    processItem(regionId, itemObject) {\n        const findItem = itemsDb.query({\n            select: [],\n            where: [{property: &quot;uid&quot;, comparison: &quot;equalTo&quot;, value: itemObject.uid}]\n        });\n        if (findItem.length === 0) {\n            itemsDb.createDocument(itemObject);\n        } else {\n            itemsDb.updateDocument(findItem[0].id, itemObject);\n        }\n        const objectToSearchTitle = {\n            uid: itemObject.uid,\n            title: itemObject.title.toLowerCase()\n        };\n        this.helper.addToTitlesArray(regionId, objectToSearchTitle);\n    }\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>Service for downloading in background:</p>\n<pre><code>@Injectable({\n    providedIn: &quot;root&quot;\n})\nexport class CityDataService implements OnDestroy {\n\n    constructor(private dataService: DataService) {\n        console.log(&quot;Service starts&quot;);\n    }\n\n    loadCity(item, languageId: number = 2) {\n        setTimeout(() =&gt; {\n            this.dataService.downloadData(item.uid, languageId).then((items: Array&lt;object&gt;) =&gt; {\n                if (items !== undefined &amp;&amp; items !== null) {\n                    const itemsCount = items.length;\n                    const imagesLoadedObject = {count: 0};\n                    if (items.length &gt; 0) {\n                        let itemsCounter = 0;\n                        const itemsArray = _.clone(items);\n                        const loadInterval = setInterval(() =&gt; {\n                             // I start loading from my component, then hide app and still see this log, \n                             // but if I open the app again and Android has already removed it from RAM \n                             // (as I think, because sometimes all is ok and new service doesn't start) \n                             // I get new log &quot;Service starts&quot; from constructor and continue getting                                              \n                             // logs from here, because old service object is still alive\n                             console.log(&quot;Loading...&quot;);\n                             const itemElement = itemsArray.shift();\n                             if (itemElement !== undefined &amp;&amp; itemElement !== null) {\n                                 itemsCounter += 1;\n                                 this.dataService.processItem(item.uid, itemElement);\n                             } else {\n                                 clearInterval(loadInterval);\n                                 // some code...\n                                 this.loadedData[item.uid] = true;\n                             }\n                         }, 10);\n                    }\n                }\n            });\n\n            const completeInterval = setInterval(() =&gt; {\n                if (this.loadedData[item.uid] || false) {\n                    clearInterval(completeInterval);\n                    // some code...\n                }\n            }, 500);\n       }, 10);\n    }\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>Component:</p>\n<pre><code>@Component({\n    selector: &quot;...&quot;,\n    templateUrl: &quot;...&quot;\n})\nexport class CityChooseComponent extends CommonComponent implements OnInit {\n\n    constructor(\n        private dataService: DataService,\n        private cityDataService: CityDataService,\n        private routerExtensions: RouterExtensions,\n        private _route: ActivatedRoute,\n        translate: TranslateService\n    ) {\n        super(translate);\n        this.helper = new Helper(translate);\n    }\n\n    loadCity(item) {\n         this.cityDataService.loadCity(item, getNumber(Constants.LANGUAGE_ID));\n    }\n}\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":876,"question_id":64874923,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<p>I am attempting, with my very limited Javascript knowledge, to write vanilla Javascript to some buttons to achieve the following:</p>\n<p>a) Click any button, e.g. button1 and its content is displayed\nb) Click the same button and its content is hidden\nc) Click a button again (e.g. button1) and then click another button (e.g. button2) and button2 content is displayed whilst also closing the previously clicked button (button1).</p>\n<p>However, I can only achieve two out of those three steps:</p>\n<p>For example, I have three buttons:</p>\n<p><strong>Scenario 1</strong></p>\n<p>In Scenario 1 I can achieve a) but not b) or c)</p>\n<p>I can click button1 to show its content and then click button2 to open its content and hide the content of button1. What I can't do is then click button2 again to hide its content so the content of all buttons is hidden again.</p>\n<p>As per this snippet:</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>let Buttons = document.querySelectorAll(\".button\");\nfor (let button of Buttons) {\n    button.addEventListener('click', (e) =&gt; {\n    const et = e.target;\n    const active = document.querySelector(\".clicked\");\n    if (active) {\n    active.classList.remove(\"clicked\");\n    active.classList.add(\"not-clicked\");\n    active.nextElementSibling.classList.toggle(\"hidden\");\n    }\n    et.classList.toggle(\"clicked\");\n    et.classList.toggle(\"not-clicked\");\n    et.nextElementSibling.classList.toggle(\"hidden\");\n });\n}</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-css lang-css prettyprint-override\"><code>.hidden {\n display: none;\n ]</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-html lang-html prettyprint-override\"><code>            &lt;div&gt;\n            &lt;button class=\"button not-clicked\" type=\"button\" &gt;Button 1&lt;/button&gt;\n            &lt;p class=\"level-1 hidden\" data-number=\"2\"&gt;Content of button 1&lt;/p&gt;\n        &lt;/div&gt;\n        &lt;div&gt;\n            &lt;button class=\"button not-clicked\" type=\"button\" &gt;Button 2&lt;/button&gt;\n            &lt;p class=\"level-1 hidden\"&gt;Content of button 2&lt;/p&gt;\n        &lt;/div&gt;\n        &lt;div&gt;\n            &lt;button class=\"button not-clicked\" type=\"button\" &gt;Button 3&lt;/button&gt;\n            &lt;p class=\"level-1 hidden\"&gt;Content of button 3&lt;/p&gt;\n        &lt;/div&gt;</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n<p><strong>Scenario 2</strong>\nIn Scenario 2 I can achieve a) and b) but not c)</p>\n<p>In the following snippet, I can get each button to show and hide its own content when clicking it once to show and clicking the same button again to hide, but when clicking another button, when the first is still open, the first one doesn't hide:</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>    document.addEventListener(\"click\", function(e) {\n    const tgt = e.target;\n    if (tgt.type===\"button\") {\n      const level = tgt.className.replace(/[^\\d]/g,\"\");\n      [...document.querySelectorAll('ul.level-'+level)].forEach(ul =&gt; ul.classList.add(\"hidden\"));\n      const show = tgt.classList.contains(\"button\")\n      tgt.nextElementSibling.classList.toggle(\"hidden\",!show); \n      tgt.classList.toggle(\"button\",!show);\n    }\n  })</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-css lang-css prettyprint-override\"><code>.hidden {\n display: none;\n }</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-html lang-html prettyprint-override\"><code>        &lt;div&gt;\n            &lt;button class=\"button not-clicked\" type=\"button\" &gt;Button 1&lt;/button&gt;\n            &lt;p class=\"level-1 hidden\" data-number=\"2\"&gt;Content of button 1&lt;/p&gt;\n        &lt;/div&gt;\n        &lt;div&gt;\n            &lt;button class=\"button not-clicked\" type=\"button\" &gt;Button 2&lt;/button&gt;\n            &lt;p class=\"level-1 hidden\"&gt;Content of button 2&lt;/p&gt;\n        &lt;/div&gt;\n        &lt;div&gt;\n            &lt;button class=\"button not-clicked\" type=\"button\" &gt;Button 3&lt;/button&gt;\n            &lt;p class=\"level-1 hidden\"&gt;Content of button 3&lt;/p&gt;\n        &lt;/div&gt;</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n<p><strong>Ideal Scenario 3:</strong></p>\n<p>As explained at the beginning, what I'm trying to achieve is a combination of both Scenarios 1 and 2:</p>\n<p>a) Click any button, e.g. button1 and its content is displayed\nb) Click the same button again and its content is hidden\nc) Click a button again (e.g. button1) and then click another button (e.g. button2) and button2 content is displayed whilst also closing the previously clicked button (button1).</p>\n<p>I've tried fiddling my JS like below, but I think I'm either getting a double-negative or a double-positive - possibly 'clicked' is always true? - or my use of <code>!=</code> is invalid (or both).</p>\n<pre><code>let Buttons = document.querySelectorAll(&quot;.button&quot;);\nfor (let button of Buttons) {\nbutton.addEventListener('click', (e) =&gt; {\nconst x = e.target;\nconst y = document.querySelector(&quot;.clicked&quot;); // this could include x\nconst z = (y != x); // I'm looking for &quot;include y but not if it is x&quot;\nconst q = (x = y); // If the target x already contains &quot;clicked&quot;\nif (z) {\nz.classList.remove(&quot;clicked&quot;);\n}\nif (q) {\nq.classList.toggle(&quot;clicked&quot;); // if x contains 'clicked', this will remove 'clicked'; if x does not contain 'clicked' move onto the default next line.\n}\nx.classList.toggle(&quot;clicked&quot;);\n})\n</code></pre>\n<p>}</p>\n<p>Any help, gratefully received, but no jQuery, Boolean,\n            required: false\n        }\n    },\n    components: {\n        screenHeader,\n        navigationArrows,\n        tip\n    },\n    computed: {\n        activeBackgroundIndex() {\n            if(this.backgroundIndex) {\n                return this.backgroundIndex\n            }\n            return 1\n        },\n        backgroundColourClass() {\n     return ''\n        },\n        showDesktopRightFeather() {\n            if(this.backgroundColour === 'brand-gradient') {\n                return true\n            }\n            return false\n {"body":"<p>I am trying to render a complex network using the React-Sigma wrapper. I know the base structure of this network to be many nodes of degree one and some of a very high degree. To this end, I have preformatted my graph data with x and y coordinates that represent an approximate layout, with degree one nodes clustered around the nodes they are connected to. I then want to run the ForceAtlas2 simulation <em>from this point</em>. However, when I try to do this, the simulation appears to just randomise and change the initial positions of the nodes to be in the centre, as seen in this gif:</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/EWzT2.gif\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><img src=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/EWzT2.gif\" alt=\"Node animation\" /></a></p>\n<p>Is there any way to stop this from happening and run the simulation from the initial positions? My code is below:</p>\n<pre><code>const App = () =&gt; {\n    const myGraph = getExampleGraph();\n    return (\n        &lt;Sigma\n            graph={myGraph}\n            renderer=&quot;webgl&quot;\n            settings={{\n                clone: false,\n                batchEdgesDrawing: true,\n            }}\n            style={{\n                height: &quot;100vh&quot;\n            }}\n        &gt;\n            &lt;ForceAtlas2\n                iterationsPerRender={1}\n                barnesHutOptimize\n                barnesHutTheta={1}\n                timeout={50000}\n                worker\n            /&gt;\n        &lt;/Sigma&gt;\n    )\n}\n\n</code></pre>\n<p>Code to get a random example graph like the one I described:</p>\n<pre><code>export const getRandomInt = (max: number) =&gt; Math.floor(Math.random() * Math.floor(max));\n\nexport const getRandomPosition = () =&gt; ({\n    x: Math.random(),\n    y: Math.random()\n});\n\nexport const randomisePosition = (position) =&gt; ({\n    x: position.x + (Math.random() - .5)/10,\n    y: position.y + (Math.random() - .5)/10\n});\n\n\nexport const getExampleGraph = () =&gt; {\n\n    const positions: any = {\n        &quot;1&quot;: getRandomPosition(),\n        &quot;2&quot;: getRandomPosition(),\n        &quot;3&quot;: getRandomPosition()\n    };\n    const highDegNodes = [\n        { id: &quot;1&quot;, size: 20, label: &quot;1&quot;, ...positions[&quot;1&quot;]},\n        { id: &quot;2&quot;, size: 20, label: &quot;2&quot;, ...positions[&quot;2&quot;] },\n        { id: &quot;3&quot;, size: 20, label: &quot;3&quot;, ...positions[&quot;3&quot;] }\n    ];\n    const nodes = Object.assign([], highDegNodes);\n    const edges = [];\n\n    for(let i = 0; i &lt; 50; i += 1) {\n        const id = (i + 4) + '';\n        const node = { id, size: 1, label: id, x: 0, y: 0 };\n\n        const target = (getRandomInt(3) + 1) + '';\n        edges.push({\n            id: `${id}:${target}:${i}`,\n            source: id,\n            target,\n        });\n\n        const nodePos = randomisePosition(positions[target]);\n        node.x = nodePos.x;\n        node.y = nodePos.y;\n        nodes.push(node);\n\n        if (Math.random() &lt; .1) {\n            const target2 = (getRandomInt(3) + 1) + '';\n            edges.push({\n                id: `${id}:${target2}:${i}:2`,\n                source: id,\n                target: target2,\n            });\n        }\n    }\n\n    return {\n        nodes,\n        edges\n    }\n};\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":891,"question_id":64874518,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<p>I work on a ajax form on an ASP.NET MVC app with a lot of pages, on each page we can submit informations. It's work corretly everywhere except on IOS supports like safari or Iphone. x&lt;table_lines.length; x++){\n                var content = {};\n                var current_line = tabel_lines[x].split(&quot;,&quot;);\n                for(var y=1; y&lt;headers.length; y++){\n                    content[headers[y]] = current_line[y];\n                }\n                results.push(content);\n            }\n            return results;\n        }\n        function buildHtmlTable() {\n            var data = results;\n            var table = document.createElement(&quot;table&quot;);\n            table.border = &quot;1&quot;;\n\n            var tableLength = data[0].length;\n            var row = table.insertRow(-1);\n            for (var i = 0; {"body":"<p>I am trying to mock <code>https.get</code> with is nested in my custom function <code>getSecureString()</code>. <code>https.get</code> returns two json elements which <code>getSecureString()</code> uses in its try/catch section. See functions below.</p>\n<p>Online version at <a href=\"https://repl.it/@SandraSchlichti/jest-playground-4#getSecureString.test.js\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">https://repl.it/@SandraSchlichti/jest-playground-4#getSecureString.test.js</a></p>\n<p>The error I am getting is</p>\n<pre><code>Expected: 1\nReceived: undefined\n\n  25 | \n  26 |     it('should return 1', () =&gt; {\n&gt; 27 |       expect(result).toEqual(1)\n     |                      ^\n  28 |     })\n  29 |   });\n  30 | \n\n  at Object.&lt;anonymous&gt; (getSecureString.test.js:27:22)\n</code></pre>\n<p>where I would have expected the test to break as I haven't included the mocked <code>res.statusCode: 200</code> response from <code>https.get()</code> yet.</p>\n<p><strong>getSecureString.js</strong></p>\n<pre><code>const fs = require('fs');\nconst https = require('https');\nvar uuid = require('uuid');\nconst {v4: uuidv4} = require('uuid');\n\nmodule.exports = async function getSecureString(options) {\n  options            = options || {};\n  options.hostname   = options.hostname || {};\n  options.path       = options.path || '/';\n  options.string     = options.string || {};\n  options.statusCode = options.statusCode || {};\n  options.aftaleId   = options.aftaleId || {};\n  options.certFile   = options.certFile || {};\n  options.keyFile    = options.keyFile || {};\n  options.timeout    = options.timeout || 0;\n\n  const opt = {\n    hostname: options.hostname,\n    port: 443,\n    path: options.path,\n    method: 'GET',\n    cert: fs.readFileSync(options.certFile),\n    key: fs.readFileSync(options.keyFile),\n    headers: {'AID': options.aftaleId,\n              'TID': uuidv4(),\n              'RID': uuidv4()\n             },\n    };\n\n  opt.agent = new https.Agent(opt);\n\n  try {\n    const r = await httpsGet(opt, options.timeout);\n    return (r.statusCode === options.statusCode &amp;&amp; r.body.includes(options.string)) ? 1 : 0;\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error(error);\n  }\n};\n\nfunction httpsGet(opts, timeout) {\n  return new Promise((resolve, reject) =&gt; {\n    const req = https.get(opts, (res) =&gt; {\n      let body = '';\n      res.on('data', (data) =&gt; {\n        body += data.toString();\n      });\n\n      res.on('end', () =&gt; {\n        resolve({body, statusCode: res.statusCode});\n      });\n    });\n\n    req.setTimeout(timeout, function() {\n      req.destroy('error');\n    });\n\n    req.on('error', (e) =&gt; {\n      console.error(e);\n      reject(e);\n    });\n  });\n};\n</code></pre>\n<p><strong>getSecureString.test.js</strong></p>\n<pre><code>const getSecureString = require('./getSecureString');\nconst https = require('https');\n\njest.mock('https');\n\ndescribe(&quot;getSecureString &quot;, () =&gt; {\n  describe('when httpsGet returns expected statusCode and body includes expected string', () =&gt; {\n    let result;\n    beforeAll(async () =&gt; {\n      https.get.mockResolvedValue({\n        body: 'xyz secret_string xyz',\n        //res.statusCode: 200\n      })\n      result = await getSecureString({\n        hostname:   'encrypted.google.com',\n        path:       '/',\n        string:     'secret_string',\n        statusCode: 200,\n        aftaleId:   1234,\n        certFile:   './test.crt',\n        keyFile:    './test.key',\n        timeout:    1000,\n      })\n    });\n\n    it('should return 1', () =&gt; {\n      expect(result).toEqual(1)\n    })\n  });\n\n  describe('when httpsGet returns expected statusCode and body includes expected string', () =&gt; {\n    let result;\n    beforeAll(async () =&gt; {\n      https.get.mockResolvedValue({\n        body: 'xyz secret_string xyz',\n        //res.statusCode: 200\n      })\n      result = await getSecureString({\n        hostname:   'encrypted.google.com',\n        path:       '/',\n        string:     'not_secret_string',\n        statusCode: 201,\n        aftaleId:   1234,\n        certFile:   './test.crt',\n        keyFile:    './test.key',\n        timeout:    1000,\n      })\n    });\n\n    it('should return 0', () =&gt; {\n      expect(result).toEqual(0)\n    })\n  });\n\n  describe(&quot;when an exception is thrown&quot;, () =&gt; {\n    let result;\n    beforeAll(async () =&gt; {\n      // mockRejected value returns rejected promise\n      // which will be handled by the try/catch\n      https.get.mockRejectedValue({\n        body: 'xyz secret_string xyz',\n        //res.statusCode: 200\n      })\n      result = await getSecureString();\n    })\n\n    it('should return -1', () =&gt; {\n      expect(result).toEqual(-1)\n    })\n  });\n\n});\n</code></pre>\n<h1>Question</h1>\n<p>Can anyone figure out why I get the above error, and how I can mock both <code>body</code> and <code>res.statusCode</code> in <code>https.get()</code>?</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":913,"question_id":64873801,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

Here's what's going wrong. I want a toaster message to pop-up on startup when the NFC reader is attached. But, when I quickly navigate to another component, it does get displayed briefly.</p>\n<p>When I call toaster inside handleNFC() but outside the NFC callback, it works fine. I thought I would be saved from scope changes by using ES6 arrow functions? My fundamentals are letting me down...</p>\n<p>When I call a route change from the callback, the new component is rendered under the current one.            url: &quot;/Calendar/GetEventData&quot;,\n                dataType: &quot;JSON&quot;,\n                success: function (data) {\n            jq341.each(data, function (i, v) {\n calEvent.end.format(&quot;DD-MMM-YYYY HH:mm a&quot;)));\n                    }\n                    description.append(jq341('&lt;p /&gt;').html('&lt;b&gt;Description:&lt;/b&gt;' + calEvent.description));\n                    jq341('#myModal #pDetails').empty().html(description);\n\n                    jq341('#myModal').modal();\n                },\n                selectable: true,\n                select: function (start, end) {\n                selectedEvent = {\n                eventID: 0,\n                title: '',\n                counselor:'',\n                description: '',\n                start: start,\n                end: end,\n                allDay: false,\n                color: ''\n            };\n                    openAddEditForm();\n                    jq341('#calendar').fullCalendar('unselect');\n                },\n                editable: true,\n                eventDrop: function (event) {\n                    var data = {\n                        UserId: event.userID,\n                        EventId: event.eventID,\n                        Title: event.title,\n                        Counselor: event.counselor,\n                        EventStart: event.start.format('DD/MM/YYYY HH:mm A'),\n                        EventEnd: event.end != null ? event.end.format('DD/MM/YYYY HH:mm A') : null,\n                        Description: event.description,\n                        ThemeColor: event.color,\n                        AllDay: event.allDay\n                    };\n                    SaveEvent(data);\n                }\n            })\n        }\n\n        jq341('#btnEdit').click(function () {\n            //Open modal dialog for edit event\n            openAddEditForm();\n        })\n        jq341('#btnDelete').click(function () {\n            if (selectedEvent != null &amp;&amp; confirm('Are you sure?')) {\n            jq341.ajax({\n                type: &quot;POST&quot;,\n                contentType: &quot;application/json; charset=utf-8&quot;,\n                url: '/Calendar/DeleteEvent',\n                data: { 'eventID': selectedEvent.eventID },\n                success: jq341('#myModal').modal('hide');\n                    }\n                },\n                error: function () {\n                    alert('Failed');\n                }\n            })\n        }\n        })\n        //jq341(function () {\n            jq341('#dtp1,#dtp2').datetimepicker({\n                format: 'DD/MM/YYYY HH:mm A'\n            });\n        // });\n\n         jq341('#divEndDate').show();\n                }\n            });\n\n            function openAddEditForm() {\n                if (selectedEvent != null) {\n    jq341('#ddCounselor').val(selectedEvent.counselor);\n                    jq341('#txtStart').val(selectedEvent.start.format('DD/MM/YYYY HH:mm A'));\n null ? selectedEvent.end.format('DD/MM/YYYY HH:mm A') : '');\n                    jq341('#txtDescription').val(selectedEvent.description);\n                    jq341('#ddThemeColor').val(selectedEvent.color);\n                }\n                jq341('#myModal').modal('hide');\n                jq341('#myModalSave').modal();\n            }\n\n           return;\n                }\n                if (jq341('#txtStart').val().trim() == &quot;&quot;) {\n                    alert('Start date required');\n                    return;\n                }\n                if (jq341('#chkIsFullDay').is(':checked') == false &amp;&amp; jq341('#txtEnd').val().trim() == &quot;&quot;) {\n                    alert('End date required');\n jq341('#chkIsFullDay').is(':checked')\n                }\n\n                SaveEvent(data);\n                // call function for submit data to the server\n            })\n\n            function SaveEvent(data) {\n                jq341.ajax({\n                    type: &quot;POST&quot;,\n                    contentType: &quot;application/json; charset=utf-8&quot;,\n                    url: '/Calendar/SaveEvent',\n                    data: { 'userID': selectedEvent.userID},\n                    //data: data,\n                    success: function (data) {\n                        if (data.status) {\n                            //Refresh the calender\n                            FetchEventAndRenderCalendar();\n                            jq341('#myModalSave').modal('hide');\n                        }\n                    },\n                    error: function () {\n                        alert('Failed');\n                    }\n                })\n            }\n &quot;no User Id!&quot; });\n            }\n            var events = db.Events.ToList();\n            return Json(events);\n        }\n\n        [HttpPost]\n        public IActionResult SaveEvent([FromBody] Event evt)\n        {\n            var userId = _userManager.GetUserId(User);\n            var status = false;\n            int eventId = 0;\n\n            if (!ModelState.IsValid)\n            {\n                Response.StatusCode = (int)HttpStatusCode.InternalServerError;\n                return Json(new { Data = false, ErrorMessage = &quot;no User Id!&quot; });\n            }\n\n            if (evt.EventId &gt; 0)\n            {\n                //Update the event\n                var v = db.Events.Where(a =&gt; a.EventId == evt.EventId).FirstOrDefault();\n                if (v != null)\n\n                userId = evt.UserId;\n                v.EventId = evt.EventId;\n                v.Title = evt.Title;\n                v.Description = evt.Description;\n                v.EventStart = evt.EventStart;\n                v.EventEnd = evt.EventEnd;\n                v.AllDay = evt.AllDay;\n                v.ThemeColor = evt.ThemeColor;\n            }\n\n            else\n            {\n                db.Events.Add(evt);\n            }\n            db.SaveChanges();\n            status = true;\n            return Json(new { status, eventId });\n    }\n\n        [HttpPost]\n        public IActionResult DeleteEvent([FromBody] Event evt, int id)\n        {\n            string message = String.Empty;\n            var status = false;\n\n            var v = db.Events.Where(a =&gt; a.EventId == id).FirstOrDefault();\n            if (v != null)\n            {\n                db.Events.Remove(v);\n {"body":"<p>I have an object instance that is created in a function that I cannot modify. This function returns an object instance but asynchronously does actions to the instance.</p>\n<pre class=\"lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>function makeFoo() {\n  const foo = {}\n  setTimeout(() =&gt; foo.bar = 'value', 1000)\n  return foo\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>I want to be able observe any changes to this object instance, where-ever they may come from. Obviously <code>Object.observe</code> is a dead standard so it's not possible to use that.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Archive/Web/JavaScript/Object.observe\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">With proxies being the suggested replacement</a> for <code>Object.observe</code>, I thought to look there but due to the fact that you must make changes to the <code>Proxy</code> handler instance and not the original object instance, I keep falling into pitfalls trying to observe changes (such as the aforementioned case).</p>\n<pre class=\"lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>const foo = makeFoo()\n\nconst fooProxy = new Proxy(foo, {\n  set(target, key, value) {\n    console.log('Intercepted')\n    target[key] = value\n  }\n})\n</code></pre>\n<p>The above doesn't work because the <code>makeFoo</code> function references the original instance directly. This issue also extends to class constructors where trying to trap:</p>\n<pre class=\"lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>class Foo {\n  constructor(){\n    setTimeout(() =&gt; this.bar = 'value', 1000)\n  }\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>But this can be overcome by replacing the class constructor with a function that uses <code>Reflect.construct</code>, proactively modifying who <code>this</code> is.</p>\n<p>I had limited success patching all of the properties on the object with getters/setters, but this will miss new properties added to the object and is a challenging implementation with plenty of caveats.</p>\n<p>I understand that <code>Object.observe</code> was withdrawn due to performance implications, but it seems we don't really have an alternative.</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":939,"question_id":64873247,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p><strong>Background</strong></p>\n<p>I'm creating a web page that visualize local file.\nThe page read the data from drag and dropped file object.</p>\n<p>In addition that, when user edit the local file after open,\nwe automatically reload the file to my tool.</p>\n<p>For example, I can open both browser and vim and keep showing visualized result while editing by vim</p>\n<p>To achieve that, we keep file object in JS and keep checking lastModifierd property.</p>\n<p>but for some reason, it stop working recent version of chrome.\nThe lastModified property always returns same value and make error when read after local change.\nI'm sure it was work some time in last year, and stop working in early this year.</p>\n<p><strong>Minimal code for reproduce</strong></p>\n<pre><code>  var dt = e.dataTransfer;\n  var file = dt.files[0];\n  var lastModified = 0;\n  var update = function(){\n    if (lastModified != file.lastModified) {\n      lastModified = file.lastModified;\n      div.innerText = lastModified;\n      setTimeout(update,1000);\n    }\n  };\n  update();\n</code></pre>\n<p>You can test here. drag and drop a file to red box then edit the file in local.\n<a href=\"http://jsfiddle.net/p8dc7ywm/3/\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">http://jsfiddle.net/p8dc7ywm/3/</a></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Expected result: When I edit the file, the content of the div will be update.</li>\n<li>Actual result: the content of the div won't change.</li>\n</ul>\n<p><strong>Question</strong></p>\n<p>Is there any way to allow the access?\nIs there any alternative solution for my project?</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":938,"question_id":64873257,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<p>After a page loads, I’d like to observe an element (addonCard) using the Intersection Observer API to know if that element is <strong>fully</strong> visible or not. burger.classList.toggle('no-shadow');\n    nav.classList.toggle('nav-active');\n    // Links fade efffect\n    navLinks.forEach((link, index) =&gt; {\n      if (link.style.animation) {\n        link.style.animation = '';\n      } else {\n        link.style.animation = `navLinkFade .5s ease forwards ${index / 5 + .2}s`;\n      }\n      //ADDED\n      link.addEventListener('click', () =&gt; {"body":"<p><strong>Chrome</strong>.</p>\n<p>ICE candidate string generatred on computer A (taken directly from the SDP attribute &quot;candidate&quot;):</p>\n<pre><code>candidate:2999745851 1 udp 2122260223 192.168.X.1 65398 typ host generation 0 ufrag XBYY network-id 2\n</code></pre>\n<p>Now that is passed through signaling, to be received on computer B.</p>\n<p>computer B received (iceStr):</p>\n<pre><code>candidate:2999745851 1 udp 2122260223 192.168.X.1 65398 typ host generation 0 ufrag XBYY network-id 2\n</code></pre>\n<p>and tries to <code>let candidate = new RTCIceCandidate(iceStr)</code></p>\n<p>This results in</p>\n<blockquote>\n<p>TypeError: Failed to construct 'RTCIceCandidate': cannot convert to\ndictionary.</p>\n</blockquote>\n<p>Computer B does so in order to perform</p>\n<pre><code>addIceCandidate(candidate) \n</code></pre>\n<p>on the RTCPeerConnection object.</p>\n<p>yet, due to the prior error, unable to proceed.</p>\n<p><strong>Reproducable example</strong></p>\n<pre><code> &lt;script type=&quot;text/javascript&quot;&gt;\n let c ='candidate:2445384676 1 udp 2122194687 192.168.1.26 57088 typ host generation 0 ufrag z1J2 network-id 1 network-cost 10';\n let candidate = new RTCIceCandidate(c);\n&lt;/script&gt;\n</code></pre>\n<p>Ideas?</p>\n<p>All the official code samples and docs instruct to send that very parameter to remote peer. <a href=\"https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/onicecandidate\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCPeerConnection/onicecandidate</a></p>\n<p>Then there's some confusion with deprecation (constructed under the hood by other functions it seems ) and JSON encoding so which one is it.</p>\n<p>From the official samples:\n<a href=\"https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebRTC_API/Signaling_and_video_calling\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebRTC_API/Signaling_and_video_calling</a></p>\n<pre><code>    function handleNewICECandidateMsg(msg) {\n  var candidate = new RTCIceCandidate(msg.candidate);\n\n  myPeerConnection.addIceCandidate(candidate)\n    .catch(reportError);\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>The value seems to be also passed directly to   <code>var candidate = new RTCIceCandidate(msg.candidate);</code> which ends up as an exercise in futility (same error).</p>\n<p><strong>UPDATE:</strong> Looks like the API only understands a String OBJECT  (which is sort of a pitty considering the EVENT contains a primitive type!) i.e.\nreproducable sample</p>\n<pre><code>    &lt;script type=&quot;text/javascript&quot;&gt;\n let c = new String('candidate:2445384676 1 udp 2122194687 192.168.1.26 57088 typ host generation 0 ufrag z1J2 network-id 1 network-cost 10');\n let candidate = new RTCIceCandidate(c);\n&lt;/script&gt;\n</code></pre>\n<p>But, even then Chrome produces an exception</p>\n<blockquote>\n<p>TypeError: Failed to construct 'RTCIceCandidate': sdpMid and sdpMLineIndex are both null.</p>\n</blockquote>\n<p>There seem to be other 'doubtful' things..like the  WebRTC offer contains  platform-specific new-line characters.</p>\n<p>RTCSessionDescription cannot be instantiated directly from SDP offer returned from event since it's a PRIMITIVE type and RTCSessionDescription() wants String OBJECT. Additionally, the primitive type cannot be easily converted to String since it contains platform specific new-lines and thus simple new String(SDP) results in a malformed String Object.</p>\n<p>anyone?</p>\n<p><strong>UPDATE</strong> In case of the WebRTC offer, the documentation does not state that one needs to provide an explicit JSON object to RTCSessionDescription containing both the type (lame 'offer' string) and SDP fields. Which sort of implicitly forces the use of JSON  (inefficient encoding) in the first place throughout the signaling process. (were one no to reconstruct the lame fields on his own but then this contradicts the black-box attitude all over the place)</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":950,"question_id":64873098,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I will try to explain my problem because I think it is complicated and I didn't find anything that helped me.</p>\n<p>I am using a JavaScript file and Puppeteer to scrape some info from a website.\nI ran into the problem that I want to execute this JS with a click on a button on an HTML site BUT I need to execute it outside of HTML. {"body":"<p>I need to validate the val in verify function i wrote the below verify function but not working it\nis giving runtime error</p>\n<p>the two functions makeInputVerifier and main function are already existing .</p>\n<pre><code>function makeInputVerifier(minimum, maximum) {\n  // write your code here\n  var mini=minimum;\n  var maxi=maximum;\n}\nfunction verify(val){\n    if(val&lt;mini)return &quot;Input is less than minimum value&quot;;\n    if(val&gt;=mini &amp;&amp; val&lt;=maxi)return &quot;Input is in range&quot;;\n    return &quot;Input is more than maximum value&quot;;\n}\n\n\nfunction main() {\n  const ws = fs.createWriteStream(process.env.OUTPUT_PATH);\n\n  const min = parseInt(readLine().trim());\n  const max = parseInt(readLine().trim());\n  const verify = makeInputVerifier(min, max);\n\n  const input = parseInt(readLine().trim());\n  const result = verify(input);\n\n  ws.write(`${result}\\n`);\n  ws.end();\n}\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":961,"question_id":64872918,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<p>I have a system where I am authenticating and storing user data in Vuex and then validating which views to show or not. });\n\n        commit(SET_USER, response.data);\n\n        Vue.prototype.$snotify.success(&quot;Login Successfully&quot;, {\n          showProgressBar: true,\n          timeout: 2000,\n        });\n      } catch (error) {\n        commit(USER_REQUEST_ERROR, error);\n        Vue.prototype.$snotify.error(error.message || &quot;Some thing went wrong&quot;, {\n          showProgressBar: true,\n          timeout: 2000,\n        });\n      }\n</code></pre>\n<p>},</p>\n<p><strong>mutations.js</strong></p>\n<pre><code>import defaultState from './state'\n\nconst mutations = {\n  SET_USER(state, value) {\n    state.data = value\n    state.loggedIn = true\n    state.loading = false\n  },\n}\n\nexport default mutations\n</code></pre>\n<p><strong>login.vue</strong></p>\n<pre><code>async submitForm() {\n      try {\n        const data = await this.$firebase\n          .auth()\n          .signInWithEmailAndPassword(this.email, this.password)\n        const idTokenResult = await data.user\n          .getIdTokenResult()\n          .then((data) =&gt; data)\n\n        const authTime = idTokenResult.claims.auth_time * 1000\n        const sessionDuration = this.getSessionDuraion(\n          authTime,\n          SESSION_EXPIRE_DAYS,\n        )\n        const millisecondsUntilExpiration =\n          new Date(sessionDuration).getTime() - authTime\n        this.$store.dispatch('setUserSession', sessionDuration)\n        setTimeout(() =&gt; {\n          this.$firebase.auth().signOut()\n        }, millisecondsUntilExpiration)\n        this.$store.dispatch('login', data)\n      } catch (error) {\n        this.$snotify.error(\n          (error &amp;&amp; error.message) || 'Some thing went wrong',\n          {\n            showProgressBar: true,\n            timeout: 2000,\n          },\n        )\n      }\n    },\n</code></pre>\n<p>this login method validates user sets User State in Vuex and should redirect to dashboard(this is the problem) there is where the below vuejs router action is called</p>\n<p><strong>router.js</strong></p>\n<pre><code>router.beforeEach((to, from, next) =&gt; {"body":"<p>I have a problem in my application.</p>\n<p>I want to display my objects only, if they aren't <code>null</code>. {"body":"<p>I doesn't work as intended . {"body":"<p>I want my main Node.js application to run. So it takes care of a few routes, does DB queries and generates views. At startup a script is to be started, which executes the same operation in the background almost all the time (in a loop). This script should be initialised with data during startup, but should also be accessible while it is running. The script writes to the same database and in the best case it can tell the main Node.js application if something goes wrong.</p>\n<hr />\n<p>I tried a little bit and asked myself if this approach is maybe the easiest solution. I set a timeout on the interval of the object and pass a function. In this function I execute my operation and set the next (slightly changed) interval, which I again realise with a timeout.\nAs I understand it the rest of my application just runs on and the functions defined in the timeout simply jump in between at the appropriate moment. If I want to interrupt the endless repetition, I can do this with the object created by the timeout function. (Not implemented in the code example).</p>\n<p><strong>My only concern is, if this causes a recursion and I get an error if I repeat it too often?</strong></p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>function myFunc(obj) {\n  \n  // processing the object ...\n  console.log(\"processing the objet: \" + obj.objectID)\n\n  // calculating next interval with slight change\n  let newInterval = obj.interval + 3000 * Math.random() - 1500\n  console.log(\"next process will start in: \" + newInterval + \" ms\")\n  \n  // starting next cycle\n  setTimeout(myFunc, newInterval, obj);\n\n}\n\n// sample object\nlet object = {\n  objectID : 1,\n  interval : 5000\n}\n\n// starting infinit loop\nsetTimeout(myFunc, object.interval, object);</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n<hr />\n<p>Background:</p>\n<p><em>I would like to implement a feed reader in Node.js. The Node.js instance should receive the requests of the users and generate the respective views. At the same time, the feeds from the various feed sources are to be queried in the background. In order not to overload the capacity of the news pages from which I get the feeds, it is best practice to vary the intervals slightly randomly. Therefore a simple <code>setInterval()</code> will not work. Also note that the different sources have different update intervals. This goes from 5 minutes to 2 hours.</em></p>\n<p><strong>Which approach would be appropriate for the case presented? (worker_thread, a second independent node application, setTimeout() or something completely different)</strong></p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":966,"question_id":64872759,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
